name: (2R,3S)-Butane-2,3-diol

Each hydroxyl group (-OH) in an organic molecule generally increases the melting point due to hydrogen bonding. Two hydroxyl groups would increase this significantly. The chiral centers do not have a direct pronounced effect on the melting point. Considering each -OH group could add approximately +80 to +100 degrees Celsius, we can estimate the increase to the melting point of butane due to the hydroxyl groups.
